StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SignOso369EvalTask]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@IdList xml, @IsSignedByOso bit, @UpdateUserId uniqueidentifier, @SignatureId uniqueidentifier
AS
BEGIN
SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL READ UNCOMMITTED
-- STEP 1: Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF @IdList IS NOT null BEGIN DECLARE @IdListTable TABLE (ID uniqueidentifier) INSERT INTO @IdListTable (ID) SELECT ParamValues.ID.value('.','uniqueidentifier') FROM @IdList.nodes('Ids/id') as ParamValues(ID) END
IF @IsSignedByOso = 1 BEGIN
UPDATE USMC.Evalua.onTask SET LastUpdatedDate = GETDATE(), LastUpdatedBy = @UpdateUserId, OsoSignatureId = @SignatureId WHERE ID IN (SELECT * FROM @IdListTable )
END ELSE BEGIN UPDATE USMC.Evalua.onTask SET LastUpdatedDate = GETDATE(), LastUpdatedBy = @UpdateUserId, EvalSignatureId = @SignatureId WHERE ID IN (SELECT * FROM @IdListTable )
END
UPDATE USMC.Evalua.onTask SET DateCer..ed = GETDATE(), LastUpdatedDate = GETDATE(), LastUpdatedBy = @UpdateUserId WHERE ID IN (SELECT * FROM @IdListTable ) AND OsoSignatureId IS NOT NULL AND EvalSignatureId IS NOT NULL -- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- STEP 4: If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
